page.title: 12Pedestrianisation.
page.content: This occured in the late 1970's & 1980's.Earlier the town centre was very congested.Previously trams ran in this area;with the influx of many cars the centre of the town became very congested.The answer was to pave the area and make roads to alleviate the congestion.Jubilee Way and Stuart Road were made,these and Ropergate became one way streets providing other routes for transport.The extension of open market days came with pedestrianisation.Now we have a Wednesday market as well as a Saturday market.On these particular days there is an air of leisureliness compared to the chaos that once prevailed and now a new shopping area has been created in Salter Row.Time will judge the planners of the 1970's & 1980's,but shopping can now be done with a modicum of safety.
